none: Letter to Louis L. McInnis from A. J. Rose, July 14, 1890
Letter to Louis L. McInnis from A. J. Rose, July 14, 1890
Box 2 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 2 Folder 3 Louis L. McInnis Papers

body.value:
[Header]

State Agricultural and Mechanical College
OF TEXAS.
(TECHNICAL BRANCH OF THE UNIVERSITY.)

A. J. ROSE, President Board of Directors, Salado Texas.
T. M. SCOTT, Agent of the Board, College Station, Texas.
LOUIS L. McINNIS, Secretary and Treasurer, College Station, Texas.

Salado, Texas, July 14th 1890

Louis L. McInnis
College Station Texas
Dear Prof.
I find my business will prevent
my going to Austin at the timed named. I regret
this, but assoon as I can go will write you.
In regard to matter, you refered about business
Prof. Bringhurst & Maj Cavitt will attend to, the bonds
that you have given in order [illegible] for you to be
released will necessitate the issuing of new ones
and approval. Now if there is any thing further
that you think that the Board should do please
write me plainly.
Prof as I wrote you I have my
hands full for the present. Let me hear from
you & oblige

[Signature]

A. J. Rose
